edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image

Class WritablePixelData

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.PixelData
      • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.WritablePixelData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicPixelData, ImagePlusPixelData, ImgLibPixelData

    public abstract class WritablePixelData
extends PixelData
implements java.io.Serializable
    An extension of a PixelData object that also supports writing of image data.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller
    See Also:
    PixelData, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WritablePixelData

        protected WritablePixelData()

      • WritablePixelData

        public WritablePixelData(ImageCoordinate sizes,
                 java.lang.String dimensionOrder)
        Constructs a new pixeldata object using an ImageCoordinate to specify the size of the pixeldata.
        Parameters:
        sizes - An ImageCoordinate that specifies the size of the pixeldata in all 5 (XYZCT) dimensions.
        dimensionOrder - A string made up of the characters "XYZCT" in any order that specifies the order of the dimensions in the on-disk representation.

      • WritablePixelData

        public WritablePixelData(int size_x,
                 int size_y,
                 int size_z,
                 int size_c,
                 int size_t,
                 java.lang.String dimensionOrder)
        Convenience constructor for creating a PixelData object with individual dimension sizes instead of the sizes lumped into an ImageCoordinate.
        Parameters:
        size_x - Size of the pixel data in the X-dimension.
        size_y - Size of the pixel data in the Y-dimension.
        size_z - Size of the pixel data in the Z-dimension.
        size_c - Size of the pixel data in the C-dimension.
        size_t - Size of the pixel data in the T-dimension.
        dimensionOrder - A string made up of the characters "XYZCT" in any order that specifies the order of the dimensions in the on-disk representation.

    • Method Detail

      • setPixel

        public abstract void setPixel(int x,
            int y,
            int z,
            int c,
            int t,
            float value)
        Gets the value of a single pixel at the specified coordinates.

        Note that the parameters are passed in the order x,y,z,c,t regardless of the ordering in the underlying byte array representation and will be converted to the correct ordering automatically.

        Likewise, though the value is passed as a float, it will be converted automatically to the underlying byte representation in the correct format. This may lead to the truncation of the passed float value when retrieving the byte array representation. However, the float passed in can still be retreived without truncation by calling PixelData.getPixel(int, int, int, int, int).

        (All coordinates are zero-indexed.)

        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        y - The y-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        z - The z-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        c - The c-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        t - The t-coordinate of the pixel to return.
        value - The value to which the pixel at the specified coordinates will be set.
